Military Secret.
From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,
7th January 1920.
(Received 8th.)
203. No. 142. Part I. - I. Up to date Afridis have handed in 72 rifles and (? one) Lewis (? gun omitted).
2. Reference para. 5 of Serial No. 141. Waziri gang which raided Khorak consisted of Kabul Khels and nomad Waziris from Kaitu, estimated at 200 strong. Constabulary and (corrupt group) had ten casualties.
3. Kabul Khel Waziris of Birshame (Afghanistan) reported to be collecting lashkar to raid in Tochi or Bannu. They are endeavouring to persuade Waziris in Khost and Tochi to join them.
4. Fazal Din and Musa Khan with 700 Mahsuds and few Tochi Waziris are still up Takki Zam with intention of opposing our advance. Wana Waziris have not yet joined them.
5. Our casualties on 2nd January were approximately (?67)
6. Lashkar of Kharoti Ghilzai Powindahs reported in Sheranni country with intention of raiding in Derajat.
Part II.-7. Derajat column still at Kotkai. Two permanent pickets established to north and west, considerable sniping, but no organised resistance. All paragraphs communicated to Press.
